title: Systematic Coronary Risk Evaluation 2-Diabetes (SCORE2-Diabetes)
description: Predicts 10-year cardiovascular disease (fatal and non-fatal myocardial infarction and stroke) risk in patients with type 2 diabetes aged under 70 years without prior cardiovascular disease.

parameters.name: risk_region
parameters.description: Cardiovascular risk region based on country

ranges.description: Low to moderate risk (<2.5% for age <50 years)
ranges.interpretation: Consider lifestyle interventions. Reinforce healthy lifestyle choices including diet, physical activity, and smoking cessation if applicable.

ranges.description: Moderate risk (2.5-5% for age <50 years or <5% for age 50-69 years)
ranges.interpretation: Lifestyle interventions recommended. Consider risk factor treatment if other risk factors present.

ranges.description: High risk (5-7.5% for age <50 years or 5-10% for age 50-69 years)
ranges.interpretation: Consider risk factor treatment including lipid-lowering therapy and blood pressure management. Intensive lifestyle modification essential.
Recommend risk factor treatment including lipid-lowering therapy (statins) and blood pressure management. Intensive diabetes control and lifestyle modification.

ranges.description: Very high risk (≥7.5% for age <50 years or ≥10% for age 50-69 years)
ranges.interpretation: Recommend intensive risk factor treatment including high-intensity statins, blood pressure management, and optimal diabetes control. Consider additional therapies such as SGLT2 inhibitors or GLP-1 receptor agonists with cardiovascular benefit.

references: SCORE2-Diabetes Working Group and the ESC Cardiovascular Risk Collaboration. SCORE2-Diabetes: 10-year cardiovascular risk estimation in type 2 diabetes in Europe. Eur Heart J. 2023 Jul 21;44(28):2544-2556. doi: 10.1093/eurheartj/ehad260.

Pennells L, Kaptoge S, Østergaard HB, Read SH, Carinci F, Franch-Nadal J, et al. SCORE2-Diabetes: 10-year cardiovascular risk estimation in type 2 diabetes in Europe. Eur Heart J. 2023 Jul 21;44(28):2544-2556.

Visseren FLJ, Mach F, Smulders YM, Carballo D, Koskinas KC, Bäck M, et al. 2021 ESC Guidelines on cardiovascular disease prevention in clinical practice. Eur Heart J. 2021 Sep 7;42(34):3227-3337. doi: 10.1093/eurheartj/ehab484.
formula: Uses Fine and Gray competing risk models with diabetes-specific variables (HbA1c, age at diagnosis, eGFR) added to conventional SCORE2 risk factors, calibrated to four European risk regions
notes: For patients with type 2 diabetes aged 40-69 years without previous cardiovascular disease
Risk thresholds are age-specific: <50 years vs 50-69 years
Countries are grouped into four risk regions based on WHO CVD mortality rates
Consider diabetes-specific interventions (SGLT2i, GLP-1 RA) in addition to standard cardiovascular risk reduction
For patients ≥70 years, consider using SCORE2-OP
